title: Europe’s climate policy turning into lobbyists’ playground, watchdog says
content: New research reveals that the EU’s Clean Industrial Deal has been transformed into a corporate-driven policy project dominated by heavy industry lobbying, resulting in a shift away from real decarbonisation toward deregulation and weakened climate rules.

title: One Europe, one market’ and ‘buy European’ push to boost competitiveness
content: Ursula Von der Leyen’s ‘one Europe, one market’ plan and calls from EU countries for stricter ‘buy European’ rules are central to the new competitiveness strategy. Watch the video for more details.

title: Europe Today: Trump's State of the Union; EU leaders weigh options on Ukraine
content: Tune in to Euronews' new flagship morning programme at 8 am Brussels time. In just 20 minutes, we bring you up to speed on the biggest news of the day.

title: Watch the video: 'Friendship' pipeline is tearing Europe apart — but why?
content: In the 1960s, the Soviet Union built one of the longest oil pipelines in the world to supply Warsaw Pact states. It was called Druzhba, which translates to "friendship." Right now, that friendship pipeline is tearing Europe apart.

title: EU Commission urges MEPs to vote through EU-US deal despite fresh tariffs
content: EU Trade Chief Maroš Šefčovič is pressing MEPs to push through the EU-US trade deal after Washington urged Brussels to honour its commitments – but the US Supreme Court's recent ruling striking down Trump's tariffs raises doubts about the validity of the 2025 agreement.

title: Russian intelligence claims UK and France plan to send nuclear arms to Ukraine, but offers no proof
content: On the fourth anniversary of Russia's full-scale invasion of Ukraine, Kyiv has denied "absurd" claims by Russian intelligence that they will be given nuclear weapons by the UK and France.

title: How Hungary hijacked Brussels and Kyiv with a double veto leaving Ukraine in limbo
content: The Hungarian foreign minister accused Ukraine of lying and reprimanded Kaja Kallas in a tense meeting in which Budapest used its veto powers twice to the fury of member states supportive of Ukraine.

title: Deepfake celebrity videos used to pressure Europe over Ukraine
content: Edited videos of Hollywood actors are being used to push a pro-Kremlin narrative targeting European leaders. Researchers say the campaign is coordinated.

title: Watch the video: Russia's full-scale invasion of Ukraine, four years in
content: Russia expected Kyiv to fall in three days. Military experts said it was not a matter of if, but when. But we are now in 2026.

title: ‘One Europe, One Market’: The Commission’s last attempt to boost competitiveness
content: Europe is gearing up to close its competitiveness gap with the Commission’s new ‘One Europe, One Market’ roadmap. The aim is to achieve a fully integrated single market by the end of 2027.

title: Exclusive: European Parliament rejects minute of silence for killed French far-right activist
content: The death of Quentin Deranque has provoked intense political reactions in France and abroad, only weeks before local elections in which both the far left and the far right are expected to make substantial gains.

title: EU accuses Hungary of disloyalty for vetoing €90 billion loan to Ukraine
content: Hungary's decision to veto the €90 billion loan for Ukraine has received strong rebukes from other EU countries, which see it as an act of disloyalty.

title: How deepfake scams are reaching record levels by targeting social media users
content: As deepfakes become increasingly sophisticated, the sheer amount of money being lost to online scams piled up in 2025.

title: Swedish foreign minister 'frustrated' by Hungary's 'illogical' blocking of Ukraine loan
content: Sweden's foreign minister told Euronews that the EU must find a way to push through its €90 billion loan for Ukraine and put more pressure on Hungary.

title: At least one person person killed as Russia targets Ukraine with 50 missiles
content: Explosions which Ukrainian authorities have called a terror attack have killed a 23-year-old police officer and injured 25 people in the western city of Lviv.

title: Hungary blocks €90 billion loan for Ukraine over damaged pipeline as tensions escalate
content: Hungarian foreign minister accuses Ukraine of sabotage and says his country will block financial assistance for Kyiv until transit of Russian oil resumes. Ahead of a key election, Budapest ups its anti-Ukraine rhetoric.

title: Friedrich Merz heads to China to reset strained trade relations
content: Germany aims to find “the right balance of cooperation” with China. The visit comes at a critical time for German car makers who face increased Chinese competition.

title: European Commission targets WTO’s key rule in push to rebalance China trade
content: EU Trade Commissioner Maroš Šefčovič calls to reassess the World Trade Organization’s “Most Favoured Nation” rule with China in focus. Chinese exports have surged since the country joined the trade body.

title: EU Commission seeks 'clarity' from White House after Supreme Court tariff ruling
content: The US Supreme Court ruling calls into question the EU-US trade deal clinched last summer, from past paid tariffs to future investment pledges. The Commission says it is carefully reviewing the ruling.

title: 'A Beautiful Mess' makes a new start in Europe easier for refugees
content: What can be done to improve the integration of refugees in Europe? How can newcomers be supported to get a foothold in social life? A Euronews report from the Netherlands.

title: French far right asks European Parliament to mark death of activist Quentin Deranque
content: Patriots for Europe is seeking a minute of silence int he European Parliament for Quentin Deranque, a French far-right activist who died after a brawl with left-wing activists in Lyon, during a session dedicated to the anniversary of Russia's full-scale invasion of Ukraine.

title: France says Commission lacks 'mandate' to join Board of Peace meeting as Brussels remains defiant
content: Foreign Minister Jean-Noël Barrot says the Commission "never should have attended" Thursday's meeting in Washington as Commissioner Šuica lacked a "mandate" from European Union leaders.

title: Macron defends FCAS jet project as Merz and Airbus float two-fighter option
content: The FCAS programme to produce a new European-made fighter jet has stalled in the face of disagreements between Airbus and Dassault. The latest statements from France's Emmanuel Macron and Germany's Friedrich Merz suggest a breakthrough remains elusive.

title: EU calls emergency meeting over Hungary and Slovakia's energy standoff with Ukraine
content: The European Commission has convened an emergency Oil Coordination Group meeting after Hungary and Slovakia halted diesel supplies to Ukraine, escalating a dispute over the Russian Druzhba pipeline.

title: US energy leader slams IEA's net zero agenda, suggests Washington could walk out
content: US Energy Secretary Chris Wright said the International Energy Agency should focus on energy security and abandon net zero ideas, but EU leaders have backed the Paris-based agency as a "trusted pillar" of the global energy community.

title: EU–US trade deal stalled over legal uncertainty, MEP Andrews tells Euronews
content: The Irish MEP told Euronews’ flagship morning show Europe Today that in the current circumstances, where nobody is sure whether Washington's new tariffs are fully compliant with the law, it would be more prudent to pause the EU–US trade deal.

title: Ukraine loan will happen 'one way or the other', von der Leyen says amid Orbán veto
content: Ursula von der Leyen, António Costa and a host of leaders from across the EU are in Kyiv on Tuesday to show their support for Ukraine as the country marks the fourth anniversary of Russia's full-scale invasion.

title: Between an aggressive Russia and an unpredictable US, how safe do Europeans think their country is?
content: In an increasingly volatile world, citizens across the EU differ on how much they believe Brussels should be spending on its own defence and security.

title: Poland’s FM Sikorski criticises Hungary’s Ukraine veto as 'escalation' that 'favours Putin'
content: Speaking to Europe Today, Poland's top diplomat accused Budapest of escalating its blockade of a €90bn Ukraine loan and Russia sanctions package, warning that Europe must act decisively as US support falters.

title: Europe Today Special: Four years since Russia’s full-scale invasion of Ukraine
content: Tune in to Euronews' new flagship morning programme at 8 am Brussels time. In just 20 minutes, we bring you up to speed on the biggest news of the day.

title: MEPs freeze US trade deal after Trump erupts over Supreme Court ruling
content: European Parliament negotiators on Monday suspended the EU-US trade pact, as threats from Washington and a US Supreme Court ruling cast doubt over the validity of the 2025 agreement.

title: Climate action is the world’s cheapest insurance policy, new study says
content: Climate policy is not discretionary spending but collective risk pooling, according to a Vienna University study, who argue that as natural disasters proliferate, it acts as a public insurance system that protects economies and societies.

title: 'Why do you hate Ukraine?' Hungarian minister clashes with Ukrainian journalists in Brussels
content: Hungarian foreign minister Péter Szijjártó doubled down on his veto on Ukraine aid over an energy dispute in Brussels. Szijjártó clashed with Ukrainian journalists in Brussels after Budapest accused Kyiv of blackmail over the Druzhba oil pipeline. 'Why do you hate Ukraine?'

title: EU trade chief to meet G7 counterparts as pressure mounts over US tariff threats
content: High-stakes meetings are set for Monday afternoon after a US Supreme Court ruling  and fresh tariff threats from Washington threw transatlantic trade relationships into renewed uncertainty.

title: EU's 'Made in Europe' proposal suffers another delay
content: The French-led European Commission’s push to embed a so-called European preference in public procurement is attracting heavy lobbying from opposed EU capitals and foreign partners, like the United States and the United Kingdom.

title: One Europe, one market: Can the EU turn 27 economies into one powerhouse?
content: European Commission President Ursula von der Leyen announced the “One Europe, One Market” strategy, a plan to fully integrate the EU’s single market by 2027 to help the bloc catch up with the United States and China.

title: Double Hungarian veto thwarts loan for Ukraine and new sanctions on Russia
content: "We should not tie together things that are not connected to each other at all," High Representative Kaja Kallas said on Monday amid a new crisis caused by back-to-back Hungarian vetoes.

title: Change EU rules to stop Hungary's abuse of veto, Lithuanian foreign minister says
content: With Budapest having blocked a €90 billion lifeline loan for Ukraine and a twentieth sanctions package against Russia, Kęstutis Budrys says action needs to be taken to stop Hungary abusing its veto to block key EU policies.

title: Europe's 'loud killer': Which countries suffer most from noise pollution?
content: Long-term high noise exposure is linked to cardiovascular, metabolic and mental health issues. A new report reveals Europe's loudest and quietest corners.

title: Watch the video: Trump vs US Supreme Court — the homeland tariff war
content: After the US Supreme Court ruled last week that Trump's tariffs were unconstitutional, the US president simply doubled down and announced a new 15% import tax. What actually happened, and how will it affect you?

title: Delays to Russia sanctions 'failure for Europe,' Swedish foreign minister tells Euronews
content: The Swedish foreign minister told Euronews' flagship morning show Europe Today that any delays to EU sanctions or support to Ukraine weaken pressure on Moscow at a critical moment in Russia's war on the eve of its four-year anniversary.

title: How does the EU plan to step up competitiveness? Ask the Euronews AI chatbot
content: Ursula von der Leyen has introduced the competitiveness roadmap “One Europe, One Market,” which aims to complete the single market by 2027. Wondering what Europe’s action plan is? Ask the Euronews AI chatbot.

title: Europe Today: EU foreign ministers meet as Hungary blocks Ukraine loan
content: Tune in to Euronews' new flagship morning programme at 8 am Brussels time. In just 20 minutes, we bring you up to speed on the biggest news of the day.

title: EU countries still at odds over new Russia sanctions as deadline nears
content: Brussels wants to have a new package of sanctions approved by Tuesday to punish Russia coinciding with the four-year anniversary of Ukraine's full-scale invasion. Still, a full ban on maritime services is proving an obstacle.

title: EU steel exports to US drop 30% as talks stall over Trump tariffs relief
content: EU steel exports to the US fell 30% in 2025 under the weight of Washington’s 50% tariffs. With talks between Brussels and Washington still in deadlock, the downturn shows little sign of easing.

title: EU ministers to grill Commissions's Šuica over attendance at Trump’s Board of Peace launch
content: EU foreign ministers will question Commission Vice-President Dubravka Šuica on Monday about her participation at the launch of Donald Trump’s Board of Peace in Washington, amid criticism from several member states over the Commission’s mandate and role.

title: Did the EU charge the UK billions more than Canada to join its defence loan scheme?
content: Canada paid a one-off €10 million to join the EU’s SAFE defence scheme, whilst the UK was reportedly asked for a much higher fee. These numbers stem from reports of real negotiations, but the full picture is more complex.

title: Most Europeans don't know what the ECHR does, but do they want to leave it?
content: As some European governments push for a tougher migration framework under the European Convention on Human Rights, public opinion appears firmly on their side. Yet strikingly few Europeans say they know much about the convention itself.

title: Germany's fighter jet dilemma: Faltering European dream and US reality
content: Germany is rearming with a renewed focus on buying European. But with the German-French-Spanish fighter jet project, FCAS, at a standstill, does Berlin have any real options beyond the American F-35?

title: UN Rapporteur for Palestine says she won't resign despite French backlash
content: Francesca Albanese insists she has "the trust of the [UN] Human Rights Council" in an interview on Euronews' Europe Today show.

title: Podcast: Can the EU ever become a superpower?
content: Will the EU ever become real power? Is the EU really facing an existential threat? What did EU leaders discuss in a medieval castle in Belgium’s Limburg province last week?

title: Newsletter: France lashes out at Commissioner Šuica's Board of Peace meeting
content: Also in this newsletter: The EU mediates amid Hungary and Slovakia’s energy standoff with Ukraine, and the French far right asks the European Parliament to mark death of activist Quentin Deranque.

title: Europe Today: Albanese joins us live amid calls from France for her resignation
content: Tune in to Euronews' new flagship morning programme at 8 am Brussels time. In just 20 minutes, we bring you up to speed on the biggest news of the day.
